div.p:
The printing press brought the past into existence.
It brought into existence the man who is conscious of the past (pat)
the man who sees his time, zzzzz against a back ground of
the past; the man who firsts sees himself and shows himself
to us. xmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmm The first
blow has been aimed at when the authors name is attached
to the book. The individual (indivi al) emerges. His name is ;
his name (mae) is also . Harrison emerging from the past
tells us that he has a library; that he owns a mastiff;
that he digs up Roman coins. He tells us that he has never (nev) been (ben)
more than forty miles from in . Anon is
losing his ambiguity. The present is becoming visible.
Harrison sees the pxmxmxmxmsx the present against (agains) the
settled recorded (reroded) past. The past looks degenerate (degnerate), raw,
against that past.

Upstairs in the great room , as he tells us, "our ancient
ladies of the court" were to be found reading the
Greeks and the Latins. as they sat at their needlework.
And the scholars (sch;ars) in the college (c ege) library were reading the
classics that were chained to the shelves (shlves) in the
college libraries. He turned away from the actors who
even while he dug up coins (voins) in his garden were acting their
crude dramas (darams) in the market place. Hxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxm
atxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxxmmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmx
wexmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmxmmxx Yet in spite of
the printed book and the new learning, the the
common people were still at their lewd practises.
